title: Differences in red blood cells may have 'hastened the extinction' of our Neanderthal cousins, new study suggests
summary: Gene variants in red blood cell function may have doomed the hybrid babies of Neanderthals and modern humans.

title: Why can pumpkins grow so large, but blueberries can't?
summary: Most fruit is pretty small, so why do pumpkins grow to such enormous sizes?

title: سقوط زعيمة شبكة للدعارة الرقمية بمراكش
summary: أنهت عناصر المصلحة الولائية للشرطة القضائية بمراكش، أخيرا، فرار زعيمة شبكة إجرامية مختصة في الدعارة الرقمية وتخصيص محل لـ”المساج”بالمدينة الحمراء، لاستقبال زبناء التدليك الجنسي، يتم استقدامهم عبر منصة إلكترونية تعرض خدمات جنسية. وحسب مصادر “الصباح” فإن المشتبه فيها اختارت استغلال فضاء الأنترنت لتسه…
body: أنهت عناصر المصلحة الولائية للشرطة القضائية بمراكش، أخيرا، فرار زعيمة شبكة إجرامية مختصة في الدعارة الرقمية وتخصيص محل لـ”المساج”بالمدينة الحمراء، لاستقبال زبناء التدليك الجنسي، يتم استقدامهم عبر منصة إلكترونية تعرض خدمات جنسية. وحسب مصادر “الصباح” فإن المشتبه فيها اختارت استغلال فضاء الأنترنت لتسهيل استقطاب الزبناء الراغبين في أكمل القراءة » المقالة سقوط زعيمة شبكة للدعارة الرقمية بمراكش fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: 'Extremely rare' and 'highly unusual' Roman-era tomb in Germany is completely empty
summary: An unusual stone circle that's likely a tomb is providing archaeologists with more information about life in Roman Bavaria.

title: Indigenous Americans dragged, carried or floated 5-ton tree more than 100 miles to North America's largest city north of Mexico 900 years ago
summary: Researchers have determined the age and origin of a massive tree that was found at the pre-Columbian city of Cahokia in what is now Illinois.

title: Weird symmetry between Earth's Northern and Southern Hemispheres appears to be breaking
summary: The Northern Hemisphere is absorbing more sunlight than the Southern Hemisphere, and clouds can no longer keep the balance.

title: سرقة اللوفر.. توقيف مشتبه بهما ومحاولة هروب من المطار
summary: أوقفت السلطات الفرنسية رجلين، مساء السبت، في إطار التحقيق في سرقة مجوهرات تاريخية من متحف اللوفر في باريس يوم 19 أكتوبر الجاري، وفق ما أكد مصدران مطلعان مؤكدين معلومات أوردتها وسائل إعلام محلية، الأحد.

title: Interstellar object 3I/ATLAS is about to get very active — Space photo of the week
summary: The interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is barreling toward its closest point to the sun as perihelion looms on Oct. 29. How different will it look when it reappears on the other side?

title: Did Neanderthals eat anything other than meat?
summary: Neanderthals were meat eaters, but new analyses show that their diets included other morsels.

title: 'I screamed out of excitement': 2,700-year-old cuneiform text found near Temple Mount — and it reveals the Kingdom of Judah had a late payment to the Assyrians
summary: A newfound pottery sherd has cuneiform text from the Assyrian Empire asking the Kingdom of Judah about a late tribute payment.

title: Meat eaten by city-dwelling Americans produces more CO2 than the entire UK — but there are easy ways to slash it
summary: Halving how much edible food is thrown away, swapping beef for pork or chicken and having one meatless day a week could slash the carbon "hoofprint" of U.S. cities by up to 51%, a new study finds.

title: 1,400-year-old hieroglyphs reveal name of powerful Maya queen
summary: Mayan language experts have decoded the name of a previously unknown Maya queen on a stone inscription discovered last year.

title: Strange object between Saturn and Uranus is 'evolving' its own ring system, study suggests
summary: Astronomers have found signs that the small icy world Chiron, orbiting between Saturn and Uranus, may be forming a new ring system in near-real time.

title: New images of interstellar object 3I/ATLAS show giant 'jet' shooting toward the sun
summary: New telescope images show that the interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is shooting a giant jet of gas and dust toward the sun. This is normal behavior for comets, an expert told Live Science.

title: Fruits and vegetables quiz: Do you know where pumpkins, blueberries and broccoli come from?
summary: Do you know where your staple fruits and vegetables were domesticated? Take Live Science's quiz to find out.

title: Rare half-pink rough diamond with 'astounding' weight of 37.4 carats discovered in Botswana
summary: Experts at a laboratory in Botswana managed by the Gemological Institute of America recently examined an extraordinary natural diamond with two distinct color zones.

title: Mysterious glow at the Milky Way's center could reshape a major cosmic theory
summary: A mysterious glow at the center of the Milky Way has puzzled astronomers for more than a decade. New research offers an explanation that could also reshape what we know about dark matter.

title: World's biggest X-ray laser discovers never-before-seen type of ice that's solid at room temperature
summary: Researchers have unveiled ice XXI, a new form of ice that's solid at room temperatures when subjected to immense pressure.

title: Astronomers discover skyscraper-size asteroid hidden in sun's glare — and it's moving at a near-record pace
summary: The newly discovered "twilight" asteroid, 2025 SC79, was obscured by the sun's glare until an astronomer pointed the Dark Energy Camera at it, highlighting the potential dangers of unseen asteroids.

title: Plants self-organize in a 'hidden order,' echoing pattern found across nature
summary: Scientists have discovered a "perfect disordered hyperuniform" pattern in how plants arrange themselves across many dry landscapes that allows them to make the most of water resources.

title: James Webb telescope finds that galaxies in the early universe were much more chaotic than we thought
summary: Using the James Webb Space Telescope, scientists have charted billions of years of galactic evolution, finding that galaxies near the dawn of time were much more chaotic than they are today.

title: 'Illegal' metal detectorist found a huge hoard of Roman treasure in Germany — and kept it hidden for 8 years
summary: A man found a Roman-era hoard in Germany dating to around 2,000 years ago, but he took eight years to tell authorities about it.

title: فيديو للحظة سرقة اللوفر.. والشرطة تبحث عن اللصوص
summary: انتشر على منصات التواصل الاجتماعي مقطع فيديو لعملية السرقة التي هزت متحف اللوفر في باريس، الأحد.

title: العناني أول مصري وعربي يتولى رئاسة اليونسكو.. والسيسي يهنئه
summary: ‏‎انتخب المجلس التنفيذي لمنظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة (اليونسكو) بأغلبية ساحقة خالد العناني مرشح مصر لمنصب مدير عام المنظمة، وذلك خلال الانتخابات التي جرت الإثنين، حسبما أفاد المتحدث باسم الخارجية المصرية.

title: من المرشح المصري الأوفر حظا لقيادة اليونسكو؟
summary: يجرى الإثنين تصويت حاسم للمجلس التنفيذي لليونسكو، منظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة، بهدف اختيار المدير العام المقبل، في خطوة تكتسب أهمية فائقة، إذ سيتولى الفائز قيادة المنظمة لـ4 سنوات وسط اتهامها بأنها "مسيسة"، وفي ظل الارتباك الذي أحدثه إعلان الولايات المتحدة خروجها منها.
